item.title: Outrage Over China's Treatment of Hong Kong Galvanizes the West
item.description: Complaints about China have long piled up in Western capitals, but it took Beijing’s new curbs on Hong Kong’s autonomy to galvanize them around something approaching a common cause.

item.title: Violent Reckoning for Ethiopia's Nobel Laureate Leader
item.description: Targeted killings, deadly street protests, a postponed election and rising regional tensions are destabilizing Ethiopia, posing a stern challenge to the reformist leader of Africa’s second-most populous nation.

item.title: Japan's Subsidies for Tourists Spread Coronavirus Fears
item.description: The country’s experiment with $10 billion in trip incentives and other similar programs around the globe have set off debates about how far governments should go to encourage a revival in sightseeing, eating and drinking.

item.title: Trump Signs Hong Kong Sanctions Bill, Pivots to Criticizing Biden
item.description: President Trump said he signed into law a bipartisan sanctions bill to punish Chinese officials over Beijing’s crackdown on Hong Kong, in an hour-long press conference at the White House dominated by criticisms of Joe Biden, his presumptive 2020 election rival.

item.title: U.K. to Ban Huawei From 5G Networks Amid China Tensions
item.description: The British government said it would bar telecom companies from purchasing new equipment made by China’s Huawei and gave them until 2027 to remove its technology from their 5G wireless networks, a sharp about-face that marks a significant victory for the U.S.

item.title: China Provocations Hasten Japan's Military Revival
item.description: Beijing’s naval maneuvers are reshaping security policies across the Asia-Pacific region. Japan’s Self-Defense Forces want to be ready to put troops into battle, a taboo since the end of World War II.
